04_inferential_statistics/02_confidence_intervals/03_conf_int_prop_v1

In \(n=206\) trials, there were \(n_\text{s}=129\) successes, so the sample proportion is \(\hat{p}=\frac{129}{206}=0.6262\). You are tasked with determining the confidence interval (of the population proportion) with confidence level \(\gamma=0.83\).

To do this, you first determine \(z^\star\) such that \(P(|Z|<z^\star)=0.83\). Then, evaluate \(\hat{p}\pm z^\star\sqrt{\frac{\hat{p}(1-\hat{p})}{n}}\) to determine the boundaries of the confidence interval.

(You can round answers to the hundredths place.)


  1. Determine the lower boundary of the confidence interval by using \(\hat{p}- z^\star\sqrt{\frac{\hat{p}(1-\hat{p})}{n}}\).
  2. Determine the upper boundary of the confidence interval by using \(\hat{p}+ z^\star\sqrt{\frac{\hat{p}(1-\hat{p})}{n}}\).
